definition: to skip a grade/to bypass ranks/to go over the head of one's boss
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more

sentences.english: ET: Plus, you have a cute little bathtub scene that's kind of racy.
sentences.chinese: 加上，你有點小可愛的浴盆的場面有些越級。

sentences.english: The United States will soon gain company as a great power.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個越級大國，美國不久將會有新的夥伴入圍。

sentences.english: We might even go over his head to appeal for what we think is right.
sentences.chinese: 我們甚至會越級上報，以爭取我們認爲對的事。

sentences.english: Go to your boss's boss unless you are aware of the potential ramifications.
sentences.chinese: 越級彙報，除非你清楚潛在的後果。

sentences.english: My boss got angry that I emailed his boss instead of him.
sentences.chinese: 我的上司非常憤怒，因爲我越級彙報了。

sentences.english: The college jumped him from instructor to full professor.
sentences.chinese: 學院突然把他從講師越級提升爲正教授。

sentences.english: You can skip steps and stop at any point.
sentences.chinese: 你可以越級而上，或者在任何階段停下來。
